speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, er, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: It's not here yet!

speaker: Frasier
text: How did you even...

speaker: Martin
text: You've been yakking about it for weeks!  Your new blazer's coming, it's Italian, it's hand-stitched, it cost more money than my first car.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, it's made from very expensive material.  They have to find exactly the right kind of goat.

speaker: Martin
text: Looks like they did!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters with Frasier's breakfast from kitchen_] Morning, Dr. Crane.  I made you a special breakfast.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, thank you, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: After all, blazer-day comes but once a year! [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: The doorman said he was on his way up with it.  I wonder what's keeping him? the elevator._

speaker: Frasier
text: Regan.

speaker: Regan
text: Frasier!  Long time no see.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it has been.

speaker: Regan
text: I think the last time was when you came over with that bottle of wine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, right.  I met your charming boyfriend.

speaker: Regan
text: Scott.

speaker: Frasier
text: Scott.

speaker: Regan
text: And he's not my boyfriend anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, he wasn't really all that charming...

speaker: Regan
text: [_laughs as doors open_] Well, it's nice seeing you again, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Likewise.  _Regan exits into the elevator as Frasier enters back into the apartment with a pensive look._

speaker: Frasier
text: Wasn't that interesting?  I just ran into Regan.  Seems she's not seeing that Scott anymore.

speaker: Martin
text: What, the ballplayer, is she nuts?  He had money and looks, the whole package.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, let him go!

speaker: Martin
text: Are you going to ask her out?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know, every time I've had a chance to get close to Regan, it seems I end up looking ridiculous.  Still, she did make a point of letting me know she was single again. Perhaps she's hinting for another ride on the "Frasier-go- round."

speaker: Martin
text: Now, if we could just figure out why you always look ridiculous!

speaker: Donny
text: Look, please, you're my last chance, Vinny's already... No, I understand, I understand, don't worry about it, bye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Problem?

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah, it's my bachelor party, my best man can't arrange it and I'm having a hell of a time trying to find somebody to fill in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Donny, if you're looking for someone to throw you an appropriate shindig, I'd be willing to volunteer.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh. [_worried_] No, no, no, no, I don't think so, it's okay, I just don't want to impose...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it's no trouble at all, really.

speaker: Donny
text: [_definite_] No, no, no, no!  It'll be fine, but thanks for the offer, though. [_doorbell sounds_] Frasier, I don't think we're talking about the same kind of party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Donny, if you're letting my reputation as an aesthete cloud your judgment, I assure you I am just one of the guys, capable of getting down and dirty with the rest of them! [_laughs_] _Frasier opens the door to the doorman, who has a garment bag over his arm._

speaker: Doorman
text: Your jacket, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes it_] Dear God!  You never fold cashmere, you'll mis- direct the knap!  Get out! [_closes the door_] Donny, give it some thought.  _Donny looks apprehensive.  FADE OUT_  **SHE'S SAVING THE REST OF THE BEAR FOR LATER**  _Scene Two - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier and Roz sit together._

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.  Help me decide something.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm thinking about getting my eyes done.  It's a little expensive...

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now, Roz.  Cosmetic surgery's a drastic step.  I mean, if you're worried about those bags under your eyes, why don't you try just a different concealer, perhaps a good night's sleep once in a while.

speaker: Roz
text: I meant the laser procedure so I could see without my contacts!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to waiter_] Can I have my usual, please?  Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: I just saw the most incredible thing, you won't believe it.

speaker: Roz
text: What is it?

speaker: Niles
text: You have to see it for yourself, mere words cannot... [_notices Frasier's jacket_] Ooh, new jacket?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, just came today.

speaker: Niles
text: It's nice stitching.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, chrystal!

speaker: Niles
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Is there something wrong with the knap?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, is it that obvious...?

speaker: Roz
text: [_annoyed_] Would you knock it off, what is so amazing?

speaker: Niles
text: All right, come here, come here.

speaker: Niles
text: Right, you see that rotund woman coming out of "Chock Full Of Donuts"? [_they nod_] Watch, before she gets in her car she will finish that bear claw and then go back in, this is her third time.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's what you brought us over here for, to gawk at some poor woman's struggle with junk food?

speaker: Roz
text: Big deal, so she's overweight, you don't need to point it out!  _Niles looks at them confused.  Frasier and Roz head back to their table._

speaker: Roz
text: It's rude.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's childish.

speaker: Niles
text: It's Maris!

speaker: Roz
text: [_laughs_] No way!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, are you sure, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm positive.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's hard to believe that's the same frail woman who once sprained her wrist from having too much dip on a cracker.

speaker: Niles
text: Maris was always chubby as a child, her whole life she was obsessed with keeping weight off.

speaker: Roz
text: Something must have snapped!

speaker: Niles
text: But literally, when she saw me she swallowed and her necklace exploded from the pressure.  Oh, oh, oh, there she goes, back for more.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, when I last saw her at Christmas she was her usual tiny self.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, Niles, wasn't that about the time you started dating her plastic surgeon?

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, it was.  Do you think that could have triggered some sort of binge?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Niles
text: Well, this isn't going to help. [_hands him newspaper_] Mel and I are in the society page today, that's our picture at the symphony benefit.  I shudder to think how Maris'll react to that, you know how petty and jealous she can get.

speaker: Frasier
text: They never take a photo of me and I'm in the conductor's circle!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, she moved next door to "Italian Deli."  The guy just took the two-foot salami out the window.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't face her now.  That salami string should keep her busy until I can get to my car.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Roz
text: [_notices_] Hey, is that Niles in the paper?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, he just happened to have a copy with him!  As if anyone cares about such trivial matters!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah, right.  This is eating you up, you live for this hoity-toity crap.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, I certainly do not.  Why does everyone think that? You know, just this morning, Donny said I was too fussy to throw him a bachelor party.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you did give off kinda a fussy vibe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there are other sides to my personality.  I remember back in my Boston days, you know, I mean, I had a regular bar and a regular bar stool, I even had a tab!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, if you go back you should try having a beer!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gives her a look_] Oh gosh, you know, maybe I have become stuffier.  The highlight of my week was the arrival of my hand-tailored coat.  Maybe it's time I loosened up a bit, try to tone down the whole fuddy-duddy image. [_dials mobile_] Oh, Donny, it's Frasier.  Listen, I would really like to throw that bachelor party for you.  No, no, I assure you I know what goes on at one.  Yes, I'm quite, quite qualified.  Oh really?  I promise you a night of such unrepentant debauchery that the mere memory will delight you in your old age, that is if you should survive the night! [_laughs, then to Roz_] Do you think I'm overselling it a bit?

speaker: Roz
text: Maybe a tad.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right. [_to Donny_] That's great, oh, great, great, thanks, Donny.  I'll tell you what I'm going to do, I'm going to go out and find you a stripper!  He-ha, maybe even more than one. [_laughs_] You bet! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Roz
text: Strippers, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: You betcha, a couple of real red hot mommas!

speaker: Roz
text: You don't even know where to find one, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not a clue! **MY KINGDOM FOR TWO QUARTERS**  _Scene Three - Seattle Streets. Frasier arrives and notices two stands of papers.  One is clearly marked as a sex magazine in yellow.  He checks around to see if no-one is looking and puts the money into the machine.  He opens it and takes out a magazine, however he gets his new jacket caught in the machine. He tries to pull it out yet he fails.  Then Regan enters from a flower shop behind him and notices him._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pulling his coat_] Damn!  Damn!  Damn!  Open, damn you!

speaker: Regan
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_notices her_] Regan!  Well, this is certainaly my lucky day, running into you twice.  Gosh, I guess this must look a little strange.

speaker: Regan
text: Really, it's none of my business.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, actually, it's quite an amusing story.  You see, I was just getting a "Seattle Times" here and I got my coat stuck in the machine.

speaker: Regan
text: That's not the "Seattle Times."

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm? [_looks at the paper_] Dear God!  They should label these things more clearly, this is some sort of a smut rag!

speaker: Regan
text: It was nice seeing you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Regan... Regan...!  Ah...  _End of Act One  Act Two_  _Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is on the phone as Martin reads a newspaper_

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on phone_] Well, if you get any in, could you please call me?  Thank you. [_hangs up_] Gosh, I'm off to one helluva start with this bachelor party.  First the debacle with Regan, now "Sid's Novelty Shop" is completely out of naughty coasters.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, would you stop moping, it'll all work ass.  _It becomes apparent that Martin is reading the smut magazine. Frasier takes it off of him._

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sakes! What the hell are you doing?

speaker: Donny
text: Honey, if your head hurts, you don't have to go.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I'll be fine.  Oh, Dr. Crane, I just want to tell you how happy I am you're throwing Donny's bachelor party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, there you see, at least someone thinks I'm capable of throwing a...

speaker: Donny
text: [_interrupting_] ...nice low-key party just like my honey bunny insisted.

speaker: Daphne
text: Honestly, why men have to celebrate getting married by having bouncing buzzums shoved in their faces. [_Donny pretends to act disgusted_] If I know Dr. Crane, your party'll be over by nine- thirty, we could all go out for dinner afterwards.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, that'd be swell.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, you know, if Daphne's so down on this whole bachelor party idea, maybe I should throw a more sedate one.  I don't want to get Donny in trouble.

speaker: Martin
text: Listen, your job's to give him the party he wants.  Everything else is between them. It's absolutely none of your boobs!  _Frasier pulls the sex mag away from him again as the doorbell sounds.  Frasier goes to answer it. A beautiful blond policewoman enters called Dinah._

speaker: Dinah
text: Frasier Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Dinah
text: I'm looking into a report of vandalism of a newspaper vending machine on Euclid Avenue, does that sound familiar to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I may have been in the area earlier today, er...

speaker: Dinah
text: Somebody on the scene recognized you as the perpetrator. Are you away of the penalty for vandalism?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh-oh!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I may have dented the machine a little, but I...

speaker: Dinah
text: [_pushes him back onto couch_] Frasier Crane, you have the right to remain... [_takes hat off and dangles her hair_] ...aroused. [_she rips open her coat showing him her blue sparkely bra as music begins to play from her belt_] Anything you see can be rubbed against you. [_she begins to clamber on top of him, he holds her back_]

speaker: Martin
text: She's a stripper!

speaker: Frasier
text: I get it, Dad.  Thank you, officer.

speaker: Martin
text: I knew that Daphne was going to be gone most of the afternoon so I figured I'd help you out.  Boy, if you hire her for Donny's party, he'll put you in his will.

speaker: Dinah
text: So, do I get the job? [_Daphne enters_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I think you certainly seem qualified.  Er, overqualified!

speaker: Daphne
text: What's going on?

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne!

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, well this is [_reads badge_] Officer Nasty.  She's leaving the police force and I'm thinking of hiring her as the housekeeper, you see.  I mean, once you marry Donny, you'll still be Dad's physical therapist, of course, but, er, we'll need someone around here to help with the chores, won't we?

speaker: Martin
text: Weren't you supposed to be out with Donny today?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I was, but I've got a splitting headache.  So, how long have you been on the force?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, er, I was just about to show the officer around the house and, er, discuss terms. [_doorbell sounds_]

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, it was nice meeting you, Officer Nasty.

speaker: Dinah
text: Yeah.  _Dinah and Frasier exit as Daphne opens the door to Niles and Mel. Mel is very distraught and Niles is trying to calm her down._

speaker: Mel
text: Don't tell me to calm down!  It's a complete disaster, she'll ruin me.

speaker: Martin
text: What's going on?

speaker: Niles
text: It's Maris, she saw the picture of us today and she's determined to take it out on Mel.

speaker: Mel
text: Yes, she's telling everyone I caused her weight gain by nicking her thyroid during a neck tuck.  I've already had three cancellations.  She never thinks about anyone but herself!  Daphne, get me a cup of tea.

speaker: Daphne
text: Actually, I have a bit of a headache.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, you could be coming down with something, wash your hands first. [_Daphne looks angry_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you've got to calm down, your shoulders are so tense. Oh, you know, Daphne gives a wonderful massage, it might be just the thing for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Actually, I was planning on taking a nap.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, good, so you're not busy.  Shall we do it in your room?

speaker: Niles
text: You two run along, I'll take care of the tea. [_touching Daphne's hand_] I really appreciate this, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_doing it just for Niles_] You're welcome, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, guess what your brother's doing?

speaker: Niles
text: Pressing his new blazer?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, against a stripper!

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, he's interviewing her in his room for Donny's bachelor party, but don't tell Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: And how exactly do you interview a stripper?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know but I bet there's a real show going on in there. _CUT TO: Frasier's Bedroom. Dinah is sat on the bed wearing only her underwear as Frasier shows her how it's done._

speaker: Frasier
text: Keep the gun in it's holster until the very end, you see, that way your act has more... impact, shall we say? [_takes gun out_] Bang, bang, bang, bang.

speaker: Dinah
text: Men seem to like my act the way it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I certainly can't tell you about attracting men but I do know a thing or two about showmanship.  Tell me, what sort of encore do you have?

speaker: Dinah
text: I don't have an encore.

speaker: Frasier
text: Trust me, with this act we're going to need one.  Er, I have an idea... _CUT TO: Living Room Niles arrives back from Daphne's room._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Mel's all set up with Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, maybe we ought to tell Frasier this is a good time to get that stripper out of here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Fras, okay, coast is clear, everything's fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not exactly.

speaker: Martin
text: How did that happen?

speaker: Dinah
text: Lord of the Dance here decided I needed an encore.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I assumed you had the key.

speaker: Dinah
text: I never use them!

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, we'll just have to cut them off.

speaker: Martin
text: [_heading to kitchen_] All right, well come on in here.

speaker: Niles
text: [_following her in admiration_] I'm Niles. _CUT TO:  Scene Two - Daphne's Room. Mel is lying facedown on Daphne's bed, naked underneath a towel. Daphne kneels beside her, massaging her._

speaker: Daphne
text: Now, you might come to a point where you feel like you can't take it anymore.  I call that "phase one."

speaker: Mel
text: Are you sure you know what you're doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: I know exactly what I'm doing. [_digs her elbow into the back of Mel's neck, making her scream again_] Just relax.

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, this is all Maris's fault.  You know, she actually called me and said she'd lay off if I stopped seeing him.

speaker: Daphne
text: What did you say?

speaker: Mel
text: Well, I hung up on her.  How insane is this woman?  She thinks I'd give up Niles to protect my practice?  I'm crazy about him.  The way he laughs, the way he gets that little glint in his eye when he's about to say something clever...

speaker: Mel
text: But do you know why I love him the most?  It's like there are all these things that he could be if he could just trust someone enough to help him unlock it all.  And if I could be that person - you know, that safe person in his life - well, the more I know him, the more I know that's all I want to be. [_pause, as she realizes Daphne has stopped_] Daphne?  _Daphne massages her, and Mel lets out a groan of pleasure.  CUT TO:  Scene Three - Kitchen Frasier and Dinah have their hands over a cutting board.  Martin saws at the chain, to no effect._

speaker: Frasier
text: It isn't working Dad, there's only one thing left to do.

speaker: Martin
text: [_panics_] Well, I gotta warn you, I'm not as good a shot as I used to be.  We'll have to go out on the balcony, I need a cup of coffee to steady my nerves!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  I meant go to a locksmith.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thank God, let's go. _Reset to: Living Room The three enter where Niles is._

speaker: Dinah
text: Well, wait, hold on, I have to put something on. [_doorbell sounds_]

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, I'll get it. [_looks through spy glass_] It's Maris.  At least, I think it is.  You need a bigger peep hole.

speaker: Frasier
text: What on earth is she doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: I have no idea, but we can't let her anywhere near Mel, especially now that Maris has the weight advantage.

speaker: Martin
text: Take her into Frasier's room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, wait, wait, I can't let her see me like this, she'll blab it all over town.

speaker: Martin
text: Get in the bathroom, I'll call you when she leaves.  _Frasier and Dinah rush into the powder room as Niles opens the door.  Reset to: Powder Room. Frasier and Dinah are sat waiting_

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, seeing as how we have a minute or two here, I may as well take this opportunity to end the suspense.  You've got the job.

speaker: Dinah
text: I've got a little news for you too: I've been on the clock since you slapped the cuffs on me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fair enough.

speaker: Dinah
text: It's freezing in here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, let me.  I seem to remember doing this back in my college days, fraternity hazing.  _Frasier takes off his jacket and passes it along the handcuffs onto Dinah inside-out._

speaker: Frasier
text: There you are.

speaker: Dinah
text: Here we go.  Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's hand-stitched.

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s._] Frasier, come on out.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, we're outta here. _Reset to: Living Room. Frasier and Dinah exit the powder room._

speaker: Martin
text: My God, have you seen Maris?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad, I know.  Did Niles calm her down?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he took her to your room but he had to butter her up a little.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was afraid that narrow doorway might pose a problem. _Reset to: Hallway  Frasier and Dinah are about to exit, however he sees Regan in the hallway with a bag of groceries.  Frasier shoves Dinah back inside and rests against the door._

speaker: Regan
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Regan, hello.  Er, listen, sorry about this afternoon.

speaker: Regan
text: Oh, forget about that, it was no big deal.  By the way I was wondering if you'd be available to...

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord.

speaker: Frasier
text: No need to be embarrassed about that, I do that sort of thing all the time.  You were saying?

speaker: Regan
text: Let me get all this cleaned up first. [_look at Frasier for help_]

speaker: Frasier
text: There you go.  You know, I'd gladly have helped you, it's just that I've hurt my back you see.  Oh, oh gosh, oh, oh, it's seizing up again.  You know, maybe it would be best if I just went back inside, crawled into bed, good night. _Reset to: Living Room He ducks back inside and closes the door.  Martin has now gone._

speaker: Frasier
text: It's going to be a moment.

speaker: Dinah
text: I figured.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_o.s., entering_] I'm just going to make us some tea.

speaker: Frasier
text: Back inside.  _Frasier pushes Dinah into the powder room and is about to follow her when Mel and Daphne enter.  Frasier hides Dinah behind the door._

speaker: Mel
text: Frasier, you're a lucky man having this woman on your staff. Thank you again, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're welcome.

speaker: Mel
text: Niles, where are you going with all that food?

speaker: Niles
text: Em... Dad is not feeling well, so I thought I'd bring him some comfort food.  And, er, by the way, if anyone's going out, Dad specifically requested something called a chilupa.

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, Daphne, would you mind getting that?

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not serious?

speaker: Frasier
text: You are on the staff after all.

speaker: Regan
text: Hi, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Regan, come on in. [_she does_]

speaker: Regan
text: Em, oh, Frasier, I was concerned about your back.

speaker: Daphne
text: You hurt your back?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it was just a spasm.  See, leaning against the wall like this, it actually feels a lot better.

speaker: Mel
text: Is it upper back or lower?

speaker: Frasier
text: Middle.  Actually, if you could all just leave me alone, really I'm fine just here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why don't we just get you onto the couch?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, please, please, I know what I'm doing.

speaker: Regan
text: We'll each take a side.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, stop!

speaker: Mel
text: Frasier, it could be a parasic strain.

speaker: Daphne
text: Or a bulging disc.

speaker: Regan
text: Yes, impinging on your lumbar nerves.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it could easily be anyone of those things, but did you also consider that it might be... [_brings Dinah out_] the stripper chained to my wrist!

speaker: Daphne
text: Officer Nasty!

speaker: Frasier
text: Everyone, this is Dinah.  You see this all happened because I was trying to prove that I'm a normal guy, capable of doing normal guy things like throw a bachelor party - and Daphne, Donny didn't know anything about it so I wish you'd just lighten up.  Regan, I can't even imagine where this must put us.  I guess it's time I just accept the fact that things will never work out between us.  You are certainly not to blame.  After today, I can't see that any woman would even want to go out with me.

speaker: Dinah
text: I think I would. _Frasier looks rather gleeful as Daphne, Regan and Mel look in shock.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. Martin is sat in his chair as Frasier enters that evening._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_suggestive_] How was your date?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it was nice.  We had a beer, talked a bit...

speaker: Martin
text: She has a helluva body, doesn't she?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, that was not what this evening was about.  This evening was about taking a chance, getting to know a different sort of woman.  It turns out she's really quite interesting, Dinah. She's working her way through grad school, she lives with her mother, she's extremely well-read, she even speaks a couple of languages.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it makes you wonder, doesn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it does, doesn't it?  It makes you wonder how eager we are to judge a book by its cover, how willing we are to stereotype...

speaker: Martin
text: No, I mean, it really makes you wonder what that mother looks like!
